documentation.title: KoolMenuItem Class [Javascript]
documentation.metakeywords: php menu, php drop down menu, javacript menu, dropdown menu
documentation.metadescription: KoolMenu is great PHP Menu control that is easy to use and simple to customize. With semantic rendering, advanced CSS, rich client-side api and myriad of features, KoolMenu stands out to be best choice for your site navigation.

property.name: id
property.samplecode:
<script type="text/javascript">
    function foo()
    {
        var _item_open = km.getItem("open");
        alert(_item_open.id);
    }
</script>

method.name: collapse
method.shortdesc: Make menu item collapse its sub panel.
method.longdesc: Make menu item collapse its sub panel.

method.name: expand
method.shortdesc: Make menu item expand its sub panel.
method.longdesc: Make menu item expand its sub panel.

method.name: isEnabled
method.shortdesc: Get whether the menu item is enabled.
method.longdesc: Get whether the menu item is enabled.
method.samplecode:
<script type="text/javascript">
    function foo()
    {
		var _item_open = km.getItem("open");
		if(_item_open.isEnabled()==false)
		{
			alert("Item is disabled");
		}
    }
</script>

method.name: hasChild
method.shortdesc: Get whether the menu item has child.
method.longdesc: Get whether the menu item has child. This function is useful to determine whether the menu item contains a sub group of child items.
method.samplecode:
<script type="text/javascript">
    function foo()
    {
		var _item_open = km.getItem("open");
		if(_item_open.hasChild()==true)
		{
			alert("Item has child.");
		}
    }
</script>

method.name: enable
method.samplecode:
<script type="text/javascript">
    function foo()
    {
		var _item_open = km.getItem("open");
		_item_open.enable(false);// Disable the menu item.
    }
</script>

method.name: getChildItems
method.shortdesc: Return the list of child menu items.
method.longdesc: Return the list of child menu items.
method.samplecode:
<script type="text/javascript">
    function foo()
    {
		var _item_open = km.getItem("open");
		var _children = _item_open.getChildItems();
    }
</script>
